fields.summary: address selective intermittent test failures before 10.10.2 release for 2-week clean goal.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Looking at the failures reported, it seems that there are two ways this test fails:
1. with embedded only, and then the stack trace fails like this:
--------------------------
Should not have been able to connect!
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.tryTimeout(LoginTimeoutTest.java:318)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.tryTimeout(LoginTimeoutTest.java:308)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.vetConnector(LoginTimeoutTest.java:293)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.testBasic(LoginTimeoutTest.java:284)
....
-----------------------
2. apparently with network server "only" and then there are 1 failure and one error, with the interesting parts of the stack trace like this:
-----------------------
1) client/server LoginTimeoutTestjava.sql.SQLTimeoutException: DERBY SQL error: ERRORCODE: 40000, SQLSTATE: XBDA0, SQLERRMC: Login timeout exceeded.
	at org.apache.derby.client.am.SQLExceptionFactory.getSQLException(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.derby.client.am.SqlException.getSQLException(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.derby.jdbc.ClientDriver.connect(Unknown Source)
	at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(DriverManager.java:419)
	at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(DriverManager.java:391)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.DriverManagerConnector.openConnection(DriverManagerConnector.java:101)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.DriverManagerConnector.openConnection(DriverManagerConnector.java:68)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.DriverManagerConnector.openConnection(DriverManagerConnector.java:48)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.TestConfiguration.openConnection(TestConfiguration.java:1708)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.DropDatabaseSetup.tearDown(DropDatabaseSetup.java:52)
....
Caused by: org.apache.derby.client.am.SqlException: DERBY SQL error: ERRORCODE: 40000, SQLSTATE: XBDA0, SQLERRMC: Login timeout exceeded.
...
and the failure (below) then actually happens earlier:
...
1) testBasic(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Should not have been able to connect!
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.tryTimeout(LoginTimeoutTest.java:318)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.tryTimeout(LoginTimeoutTest.java:308)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.vetConnector(LoginTimeoutTest.java:295)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.vetServerTimeout(LoginTimeoutTest.java:384)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.vetServerTimeouts(LoginTimeoutTest.java:371)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.LoginTimeoutTest.testBasic(LoginTimeoutTest.java:288)
...
-----------------------
So the login timeout exceeded message we get in teardown when the networkserver hits the 'could not connect' problem.

comments.body:
I can make the test fail fairly easily if I shorten the sleep times.
However, I cannot reproduce the teardown error for the clientserver test (which I thought would be the easiest once there is a failure).

comments.body:
Attaching a patch which 
- adds some more data to the error situation
- increases the sleep time of the SluggishAuthenticator when we get around the test cases that have failed so far 
- adds hooks to modify the sleep time on the server to do so for the network server case.

Review will be appreciated, otherwise I intend to check this in tomorrow.
